page.title: 19Wildlife 2
page.content: The ecoloy of the plateau area to the east is greatly affected by the agriculteral techniques used.The habitat is virtually all the same & the number of bird species is lower than in the western wooded valleys.A few small sheltered spring valleys were found where most of the species were to be seen.Birds seen included kestrel little owl,partridge,pheasant,yellow hammer stock dove tree sparrow skylark linnet swallow & jackdaw.The lack of wildlife in this area is probable not only due to farming techniques but also to the natural barren habiwat & nature of the plateau,particularly in winter. Ornithologically this is shown by the number of birds which nest either on the ground or low down in hedges such as linnet yellow hammer partridge & sky lark from the list above.
